title: krishnaverma
author: krishnaverma
content: Tornado Cash founder , Roman Storm, has been released on bail. He was charged on a money laundering case of $1 billion by US department of Justice. At least, him being charged is a good sign that it is not easy to get away with crypto scams now.

comments.author: trunghai2805
comments.body: Laundering one billion dollars through cryptocurrencies, perhaps this is the largest case I've known of up until now.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: That is a very unexpected release, I would have assumed the US justice would not take any chances in this guy and keep him locked up, those charges are serious enough to make anyone to consider the possibly of an espace out the country.I have a hunch this story may be used to further stigmatize crypto currency, specially those which are privacy focused.Â  Also, OP. It would be good if you or someone else included the source of this news, so no one will accuse you of making this up and also it would provide more insight on his bail release. I would do it myself but I cannot from the location I am currently in.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Wow a billion dollars!!! This is a very large amount in cryptocurrency, where did he get all this money that he laundered in the first place?Yes good news that he got arrested but bad news how many people have been scammed by this scammer?

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: What he did that make you think he's a scammer? AFAIK he only create mixing project and sadly his project alleged with criminal who use Tornado cash to mix their coins, that's why it's classified as money laundering. Scamming is an act where the founder only allow people to make deposit to Tornado cash and then they can't withdraw their coins.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: krishnaverma on August 28, 2023, 03:24:44 AMAt least, him being charged is a good sign that it is not easy to get away with crypto scams now. That is completely unrelated. It has nothing to do with him personally. The application itself, Tornado Cash, is still accessible and being used widely. The founder itself did not manage and facilitate cryptocurrency scams per se. He simply did not do crypto scams. You are taking a wrong understanding that he contributes directly to the cryptocurrency scams.The actual problem is that cryptocurrency scams can happen even without Tornado Cash, there are many tools that those scammers can utilise to hide their footprint. Charging the developer obviously did not solve the actual problem.
